definition: to the bone/to the marrow/fig. to a very large degree

sentences.english: The night air chilled my bones.
sentences.chinese: 夜间的气候使我寒冷彻骨。

sentences.english: Overnight, the North has brought heavy snow biting cold.
sentences.chinese: 一夜之间，北方大雪带来了彻骨的寒冷。

sentences.english: On the chilly seas, Keats became feverish, continually coughing up blood.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷彻骨的海上，基茨开始发烧，不断地咯血。

sentences.english: In the reality, to one another only pain and injury, biting cold.
sentences.chinese: 现实里，留给彼此只是疼痛和伤害，彻骨的冷。

sentences.english: Without a cold biting, nothing is tangy incense.
sentences.chinese: 未经一番寒彻骨，焉得梅花扑鼻香。

sentences.english: Summer day scorching sun, creek water actually still limpid Bright Static, is icy cold biting cold.
sentences.chinese: 夏日骄阳似火，小河的水却依然清澈明静，冰凉彻骨。

sentences.english: And now it chills me to the bone.
sentences.chinese: 而现在这让我彻骨地寒冷。

sentences.english: He was chilled to the bone.
The wind chill factor was pegged at a bone-chilling minus 27 degress.
sentences.chinese: 风寒因子测定为严寒彻骨的零下27度。

sentences.english: The metal pipe is freezing cold in winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬天里金属管道冰冷彻骨。

sentences.english: The night air chilled his bones.
sentences.chinese: 夜间的空气使他寒彻骨。

sentences.english: Well, have you ever noticed how uncompromisingly cold your working environment is?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾注意到你的工作环境是有多彻骨寒冷？

sentences.english: When hearing the flowers shrinking in the wind I felt my deep sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我听见花在春风中绽放的动静，痛彻骨髓。

definition: to be extremely cold or painful
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
